TopicTitle: The Delta IV Orion Launch... RECORDING HERE! (Soon)

Articles.Content: The LES is just a static version to simulate weight. It i not a loaded LES

What channel is it on?

NASA has their own 'cable' channel called NASA-TV

DirecTV: 346 (what I am watching )

Dish network: 286

For cable, you'll need to check your local guide.
LOX fill and drain valves showing 'not closed' on two boosters. Will cycle the valves to try and fix.
just launch, its a mockup of the Orion anyways
The announcer has gone quiet again
It's not a mockup, it's an actual orion.
They should just call mars. The cult mechanicus could solve this with blessed oils. :P

The LES is just a static version to simulate weight. It i not a loaded LES

Is there a reason for that? I thought it would be a simple thing to make ready and it would be immensely valuable in the event of an anomaly.
It would be immensely valuable in saving a single-use test article, which is pointless.
It's a real Orion, the service module underneath it is the mass-simulator mockup thing.

Really doubt that its going to launch today.

I've never seen a successful rocket launch despite trying to watch 5 or 6

it is a real, but mostly empty orion. only avionics, chutes and testing sensors onboard.

so its a half real orion

It's a real Orion, the service module underneath it is the mass-simulator mockup thing.

It's not boilerplate, but it's certainly not going to be carrying any people. There's no use for it after this flight.

What channel is it on?

On Uverse, NasaTV is channel 264. If your provider is different, check your guide or providers website.
Maybe they should've hired the reliable Soyuz instead, or use other launchers they have... I'm just waiting after when it'll finally launches off. On top of any rockets.
